macaulay: Commencement Address for the Class of 2025

Murray Fisher and Pete Malinowski will deliver Macaulay’s Commencement address for the Class of 2025. Their joint dedication to experiential learning in founding the Billion Oyster Project has contributed to the restoration of the New York Harbor.

Macaulay Honors College will honor Jane E. Salmon, Thalia Smith, and Thomas R. Brigandi '12 at its annual gala April 28, 2025. The college also announces the launch of the Jane E. Salmon Scholars Fund, a prestigious award that supports students pursuing biomedical research.
Awards, fellowships, and recognition for Macaulay students and alumni.

The inaugural Macaulay Honors College Outstanding Undergraduate Research is a consortium-wide competition that recognizes excellence in undergraduate research, scholarship, or the arts by Macaulay Honors College seniors. These awards also recognize the invaluable role of faculty mentors and advisors to Macaulay students’ overall honors education.
The Mountain Lion Food Pantry Opens
Macaulay has opened the Mountain Lion Food Pantry with donations from Women at Amazon, an employee-led affinity group. The pantry offers food and household supplies free of charge for students.
Students explored real-world problems through data science and collaboration. The event showcased Macaulay’s commitment to interdisciplinary learning.
Two Macaulay Grads featured in CUNY's Inaugural 50 Under 50 Alumni List

CUNY has released its inaugural 50 Under 50 alumni list, and we're thrilled that two Macaulay graduates are highlighted. The honorees represent the diverse talents and achievements of CUNY’s vibrant and expansive community. Congrats to Romario R. Ricketts '21 and Calvin Herman '20!
Seven Students Win Prestigious Gilman Scholarships

Macaulay Honors College congratulates seniors Rabia Akram, Awestaa Zia, and Jeslyn Mei (all Hunter College), James Zou, and junior Zara Aziz (City College) for winning the Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarship for the Fall 2023 semester.
Macaulay Honors College students took home top honors at Pfizer's Digital Hackathon last month. Read the experiences of Saanavi Goyal ’26 and Annah Singh ’25 of City College.

ccny: "Generative Histories Harlem" showcases work by CCNY students and faculty in the Place, Memory and Culture Incubator

An exhibit at the Spitzer School of Architecture with work by Place, Memory and Culture Incubator students and faculty is on display through April 10, 2025. The exhibit is entitled "Generative Histories Harlem." The PCMI is supported by a Mellon Grant and is led by Dean Marta Gutman and Professor Jerome Haferd.
